p: WNV is endemic to southern Africa. In 1947, one of the largest WNV epidemics recorded occurred in the Karoo region of South Africa ( 5), and another occurred in combination with a Sindbis virus epidemic in 1983–84 in the Witwatersrand–Pretoria region of South Africa. The most recent seroprevalence data for WNV in the Pretoria region of South Africa is from the 1970s (reviewed in [ 6]). To update that information, we determined whether WNV is being overlooked as a possible cause of disease in persons hospitalized in South Africa. The University of Pretoria Research Ethics Committee approved this study.
